title: Wolf Tooth GnarWolf Chainguide rev2
content:
1x drivetrains don’t require a chain guard but on some bikes and in some terrain, the extra assurance is nice. For those wanting to ride with a chain guard on their gravel or mountain bike in rough terrain, there are a number of options out there, including Wolf Tooth’s GnarWolf Chainguide which just received some updates since its first launch in 2016. Let’s check out the features of the GnarWolf Chainguide rev 2 below.

The GnarWolf Chainguide rev2 updates include a new head that has five color options, a weight savings of 2g, and a lower price ($49.95 for rev2 vs $69.95 for rev1)

The GnarWolf Chainguide rev2 was designed for maximum chain retention in extreme riding conditions. This is for mountain biking, gravel racing on the chunkiest roads (like the Roubaix!), and CX on days that make for the best photos. It is compatible with most bikes that use a 1x drivetrain with a front derailleur mount or ISCG-05 mount. It will work with round and oval chainring sizes from 28-62T and chainlines of 45-51mm depending on frame specs and geometry.

  • 8mm of chainline adjustment via our GuideLock quick adjustment system. No shims required.
  • Infinite vertical adjustment between 28 and 36T for round chainrings and 28-34T oval chainrings
  • Loosen one screw to flip the guide out of the way for easy chain removal without losing any of the guide’s adjustments
  • All adjustments made with common 4mm hex key
  • Designed for the rigors of Enduro, heavy trail, mud and even DH riding, the Wolf Tooth engineers made this guide extremely stiff and strong while keeping it light at 44g
  • Specific guide shaping is optimized for use with oval and round chainrings
  • Installation takes just a few minutes – no need to remove your crank arms

Check out more at Wolf Tooth.
